senses.sense_definition: A heap of dung, refuse, or garbage, typically found near a dwelling or farm.

examples.text: The farmer cleared the <w>midden</w> to use the manure for the fields.
Flies buzzed loudly around the smelly <w>midden</w> behind the old cottage.

senses.sense_definition: A prehistoric mound or deposit consisting of shells, bones, and other domestic refuse, indicating the site of an ancient settlement.

examples.text: Archaeologists excavated the <w>midden</w> to learn about the diet of the ancient inhabitants.
We found pottery shards buried deep within the shell <w>midden</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A pile of vegetation, waste, or debris accumulated by certain animals, such as packrats, to serve as a shelter or territory marker.

examples.text: The packrat <w>midden</w> contained preserved plant materials from thousands of years ago.
Researchers analyzed the ancient <w>midden</w> to study past climate conditions.
